newsitem.title: UK: Croatia Eurobond could total 500 mln marks- bankers.
newsitem.headline: Croatia Eurobond could total 500 mln marks- bankers.

text.p: Croatia's forthcoming mark Eurobond is expected to be for up to 500 million marks, syndicate managers said on Wednesday.
Earlier, Croatia said it had appointed Credit Suisse First Boston and Deutsche Morgan Grenfell to lead manage its debut Eurobond offering in the German market.
Croatia said that the timing, size and maturity details would be announced shortly before launch, and investor presentations would be held first.
The lead managers were not immediately available for comment, but bankers elsewhere said Croatia's deal was likely to have a five- to seven-year maturity.
Croatia would have to pay a spread of at least 50 to 60 basis points over Libor, they said.
Croatia said recently it envisaged the mark Eurobonds in mid-year. It also planned to raise 300-500 million kuna through a bond issue sometime in the autumn.
Croatia's sovereign debt is rated Baa3 by Moody's Investor Service and BBB- by Standard & Poor's and IBCA.
